title: Jamie Buhrer
text:
Jamie Buhrer (born 28 November 1989) is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played as a and for the <a href="Manly%20Warringah%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly Warringah Sea Eagles</a> and the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>. He also played for <a href="City%20New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">NSW City</a> and <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a>.
Background.
Buhrer was born in <a href="Westmead%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Westmead, New South Wales</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>. He was educated at <a href="Patrician%20Brothers%27%20College%2C%20Blacktown">Patrician Brothers' College, Blacktown</a> in <a href="New%20South%20Wales">New South Wales</a>. 
He played his junior rugby league for the <a href="Hills%20District%20Bulls">Hills District Bulls</a>. He was then signed by the <a href="Manly%20Warringah%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly Warringah Sea Eagles</a>.
Playing career.
Early career.
In 2008 and 2009, Buhrer played 47 games for the Manly Warringah Sea Eagles' <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> team, scoring 15 tries in total. In September 2009, he was named at in the 2009 NYC Team of the Year.
2010.
In 2010, Buhrer graduated to the Sea Eagles' <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a> team, <a href="Sunshine%20Coast%20Falcons">Sunshine Coast Sea Eagles</a>. In round 10 of the <a href="2010%20NRL%20season">2010 NRL season</a>, he made his <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> debut for the Sea Eagles against the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a>.
2011.
Buhrer scored his first two tries in round 4 of the <a href="2011%20NRL%20season">2011 season</a> against the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a>, where he was playing at . He played off the interchange bench in the Sea Eagles' <a href="2011%20NRL%20Grand%20Final">2011 NRL Grand Final</a> win over the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a>. Later on that month, he re-signed with the Sea Eagles on a 3-year contract until the end of 2014.
2012.
In April, he played for <a href="City%20New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales City</a> against <a href="Country%20New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales Country</a> in the annual <a href="City%20vs%20Country%20Origin">City vs Country Origin</a> match. A month later, he gained selection for the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> <a href="State%20of%20Origin%20series">State of Origin</a> team to take on <a href="Queensland%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland</a> in game one of the series in <a href="Melbourne">Melbourne</a> on 23 May 2012. He was subsequently dropped from the side.
2014.
In May, Buhrer returned to the New South Wales City side. In September, he tore his <a href="anterior%20cruciate%20ligament">anterior cruciate ligament</a>, ruling him out for the rest of the season. Later on that month, he re-signed with the Sea Eagles on a 3-year contract until the end of 2017.
2016.
In October, after playing 128 games for the Sea Eagles, Buhrer was released from the final year of his contract to sign a 2-year contract with the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a> starting in 2017.
2017.
Upon joining the Knights, Buhrer formed part of the leadership group of the playing roster. He made his debut for the Knights in round 1 of the <a href="2017%20NRL%20season">2017 season</a> against the New Zealand Warriors. During a training session in April, he suffered a fractured foot and was expected to miss up to eight weeks. He finished the year with 16 matches and 1 try for the Knights.
2018.
In 2018, Buhrer played in 20 matches for the Knights, mostly from the <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange bench</a>.
2019.
Due to increasing depth in the Knights' squad, Buhrer only played 9 NRL matches in 2019, before departing at season's end. In November, he announced his retirement from rugby league.
